question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: insert_resource()] [Cache poisoning] Can an attacker exploit the BTreeMap entry insertion logic to insert malicious DataCacheEntry objects that poison the cache with crafted struct_tag, layout, or contains_delayed_fields values, causing state corruption across transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: insert_resource()] [Double insertion attack] Does the Entry::Occupied check properly prevent race conditions where concurrent transactions attempt to insert the same resource type at the same address, potentially causing cache inconsistencies or allowing duplicate resource creation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: insert_resource()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker insert a resource with a valid Type but mismatched DataCacheEntry struct_tag, allowing type confusion attacks where operations on one type affect another type's data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: contains_resource()] [TOCTOU race] Does the contains_resource check followed by insert_resource create a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability where an attacker can insert a resource between the check and insertion in load_resource_mut, causing cache corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: get_resource_mut()] [Missing entry attack] Can an attacker trigger the UNKNOWN_INVARIANT_VIOLATION_ERROR by manipulating cache state to remove entries before get_resource_mut is called, causing transaction failures or state inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Type tag mismatch] Can an attacker exploit the ty_to_ty_tag conversion to provide a Type that converts to a non-Struct TypeTag, bypassing the INTERNAL_TYPE_ERROR check through malformed type parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Layout spoofing] Can a malicious module provide a crafted type_to_type_layout_with_delayed_fields that returns a layout incompatible with the actual resource data, causing deserialization vulnerabilities or type confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Struct: DataCacheEntry] [Layout tampering] Can an attacker manipulate the TriompheArc<MoveTypeLayout> reference count or shared state to modify the layout after caching, causing all subsequent operations on that resource to use corrupted layout information? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Module metadata manipulation] Can an attacker provide a malicious module with crafted metadata that causes get_resource_bytes_with_metadata_and_layout to return incorrect or malicious resource bytes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: load_resource_mut()] [Type parameter injection] Can an attacker craft a Type with malicious type parameters that pass validation but cause unexpected behavior when used as BTreeMap keys, leading to cache key collisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Deserialization bomb] Can an attacker craft resource bytes that cause exponential memory expansion during deserialize(), leading to memory exhaustion and node crashes despite gas metering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Malformed blob attack] Does the deserialize() call properly validate blob structure before ValueSerDeContext processes it, or can crafted blobs cause panics, buffer overruns, or undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: into_effects()] [Serialization bypass] Can an attacker manipulate GlobalValue state to produce a value that serializes successfully but deserializes into a different value, breaking state integrity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: into_custom_effects()] [Resource converter exploit] Can a malicious resource_converter function be injected that produces invalid Resource outputs, bypassing serialization validation and corrupting the ChangeSet? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Max nest depth bypass] Can an attacker craft deeply nested values that bypass max_value_nest_depth checks during deserialization, causing stack overflows or excessive recursion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: load_resource_mut()] [Gas accounting bypass] Does the gas_meter properly account for all operations when bytes_loaded is None (cache hit), or can an attacker exploit cached resources to perform expensive operations without gas charges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [NumBytes overflow] Can the bytes_loaded value overflow when cast from usize to u64 in NumBytes::new(), causing incorrect gas charges for large resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: native_check_resource_exists()] [Gas double charge] Does DependencyGasMeterWrapper properly prevent double gas charging when native_check_resource_exists calls load_resource, which also charges gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: into_effects()] [Unbounded iteration] Can an attacker fill account_map with millions of entries to make into_effects iteration consume excessive CPU time, causing validator slowdowns despite transaction gas limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: create_data_cache_entry()] [Layout traversal DoS] Can complex type structures with recursive or deeply nested layouts cause type_to_type_layout_with_delayed_fields to consume excessive gas or time in traversal_context? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: load_resource_mut()] [Resource duplication] If contains_resource returns false but the resource exists in global storage, does the code properly handle the case where create_data_cache_entry loads it while another transaction modifies it? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: into_effects()] [Double resource deletion] Can into_effect_with_layout return deletion operations for the same resource multiple times if called on cached values that have been manipulated, causing double-deletion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: get_resource_mut()] [Mutable alias] Does returning &mut GlobalValue allow creation of multiple mutable references to the same resource through cache manipulation, violating Rust's aliasing rules and enabling data races? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Struct: TransactionDataCache] [Account map manipulation] Can an attacker exploit BTreeMap ordering to cause inconsistent resource access patterns that allow viewing of uncommitted changes from other transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/data_cache.rs] [Function: into_custom_effects()] [Resource resurrection] Can a resource marked as deleted in GlobalValue be resurrected through manipulation of the into_effect_with_layout return value, causing state inconsistencies? (High)
